meanings.definition: To express approval or support for
meanings.sent1: I always indorse my friends' ideas during our meetings.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked us to indorse the new school policy.
meanings.sent3: The whole class decided to indorse the idea of having a pizza party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to indorse his decision to pursue his dream.
meanings.sent5: The loud applause from the audience indorsed the singer's performance.

meanings.definition: To sign one's name on the back of a check or other document as a form of endorsement
meanings.sent1: Please indorse the check before depositing it in the bank.
meanings.sent2: He forgot to indorse the contract before sending it out.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to indorse the important letter with its paw.
meanings.sent4: She carefully indorsed her signature on the legal document.
meanings.sent5: The CEO quickly indorsed the agreement, sealing the deal.
